column4: if i can ssh into a server, should i also be able to scp into it?
Yes, if you can ssh you can scp
i keep getting permission denied.   scp ~/my_file user@host
scp ~/my_file user@host:~/
after host: you specify the target folder on the server
that returns scp: /~: Permission denied
If you login with ssh and try 'touch my_file' does it work or give you a permission denied?
the file doesnt exist on the server yet.
I know, but do you have write permissions on the server?
Touch my_file returns a new line
And if correct there is a file created with the name my_file
oh, neat.  yes. my_File was createrd
ok, then you have write permissions :) You can delete this file
but i still cant scp :(
And are you sure you have read permissions on the local file and have the rights to execute scp ?
i have permissions. tried sudo as well.   still getting Permission Deneid.
scp my_file user@host:/tmp/ ?
ill try :/tmp/
:/tmp/ worked!
thank you
Then there is a permission issue on the server or you don't have a home folder you can use like ~/
ill have a look into that.
